title.narrative: Oxfam Jemen: Skydd, vattenhantering och lokalt deltagande
Oxfam Yemen: Protection, Water Governance and Local Participatory

description.narrative: Oxfam GB tillsammans med Oxfam Novib och Progressio ämnar stödja en existerande statlig strategi för att utveckla en deltagande och demokratisk samhällsstyrning på den lokala nivån. Målet är att stärka det civila samhällets inflytande i planering och uppföljning av lokala och nationella policies och program i 8 distrikt i 4 governorates i Jemen.

Oxfam GB will work together with Oxfam Novib and Progressio to support an existing government strategy for facilitating participatory development and good governance at the local level. The objective will be to enhance civil society's influence on planning and monitoring of local and national policies and programmes in 8 districts in 4 governorates in Yemen.

description.narrative:
In 2015 the situation in Yemen deteriorated substantially. The conflict escalated with intensified clashes between supporters of Al Houthi and supporters to President Hadi, expansion of al Houthi in the southern governorates and aerial military strikes led by Saudi Arabia to protect the legitimacy of the government. Due to the security situation many donors withdrew. Also Oxfam evacuated temporarily. Due to the situation, most of the activities planned under the Sida-Oxfam agreement in Yemen were no longer possible to carry out. Therefore Sida and Oxfam decided to change the content and instead focus on water integrity and governance, protection and local participatory governance. The amendment of the agreement was signed in August 2015. Due to the situation most planned activities for 2015 could not be carried out and a planning and start up phase for the new activities led to limited results for 2015. However during 2016 activities picked up and several results were achieved. The main results are; With regard to water governance and integrity, affected communities have been sensitised on water conservation, 20 water committees have been reactivated, 35 community based volunteers were recruited and trained and they held water conservation sessions, functional and dysfunctional water facilities have been mapped, and developed by the communities into water resource management planning, and rehabilitation of 20 water supply schemes has been compleated while employing employing water conservation technioques throuh installation of six solar pumps in Abs, Hairan, and Al Zuhrah districts.
A survey was carried out to understand the vulnerabilities of women, men, boys and girls related to water and a WASH mapping (Geo Informatics System, GIS) in order to comprehend the scale of functional and dysfunctional water supply systems in the targeted locations. The mapping highlighted a number of natural resources such as dug wells and a local stream, which could be used as an alternative solution to water trucking which is expensive and non sustainable. 60 awareness raising and sensitization events were organised on improved water conservation practises in 20 villages in three districts, formation of community based volunteers (40) both female and male have lead the community mobilisation and awareness activities in 20 villages. Oxfam Community Health Volunteers were trained as part of the project and volunteers from the targeted communities also participated in the mapping process. With the mapping, the societies could plan for an exit to emergency water trucking activities and move to more sustainable solutions such as the rehabilitation of water systems. With regard to protection, a comprehensive (country wide) protection analysis was developed and supporting the programs in humanitarian negotiations to maintain access and community acceptance. Referral systems were mapped and Oxfams staff and cluster members were trained on protection issues. Protection was mainstreamed into Oxfam programs. Cash was transfered to the most vulnerable households in collaboration with UNHCR. With regard to local participatory governance, a baseline survey for Engaging Communities in Policy Development through participation in Local Governance was carried out in collaboration with district authority, village council committees and sub district development committees. A workshop with participation local councils, CBOs etc. was held which presented the level of knowledge and capacity of the existing Community structures on participatory governance and advocacy. A mapping of civil society organisations in Hodeida city, Hays and Monirah districts has been carried out, training in financial management and administration was conducted for 15 CSOs and 15 development plans for CSOs were developed in order to build their capacity.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
